CRD_DrunkBear.synopsis: Astarion returns to camp after being scratched up by a bear. He's not badly hurt, but feels invigorated - almost drunk - after drinking the beast's blood.

CRD_Mirror.synopsis: You find him sitting by the river (or with a mirror), staring at his non-reflection. He doesn't even remember what he looks like any more, it's been so long since he's seen his own face. You can lovingly describe his face to him or gaslight him, talking about unsightly moles that he doesn't actually have.

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream.synopsis: Astarion is resting in his bedroll when he has a nightmare about Cazador carving the scars into his back.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM.synopsis: Raphael tells Astarion about the contract Cazador made with a devil to become a super vampire.
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Origin Moments - Raphael's Revelation (camp night)Take a long rest

CRD_TastingParty.synopsis: Astarion is staring at the other companions around the campfire. He's friendly and affable, but his mind is on his hunger. He starts to wonder what the others taste like, although he's MOSTLY joking. In the end he decides to remove himself, before the conversation gets too real.

CRD_ScarReading.synopsis: You find Astarion shirtless, tracing the scars on his back with his fingers, trying to read what they say through touch. Initially startled and a little embarrassed, he'll open up to anyone he thinks he can trust. An intimate moment, where he'll let characters with a high approval rating try to read what his scars say, or at least trace them into the dirt for him to read.

CRD_DrunkBear_45.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_45.context: NodeContext: Limping towards the player, but very happy - almost drunk

CRD_DrunkBear_60.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_60.text: Are you now? Don't make promises you can't keep, darling.

CRD_DrunkBear_28.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_28.text: Thankfully I've had my needs met this evening. I found a bear.

CRD_DrunkBear_3.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_3.text: He took a little of my blood, I took all of his.

CRD_DrunkBear_19.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_19.text: Where did you find a bear down here?

CRD_DrunkBear_11.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_11.text: I mean - I think it was a bear? Big head, four legs, hair that gets stuck in your teeth.

CRD_DrunkBear_31.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_31.text: Whatever it was, I thoroughly enjoyed it.

CRD_DrunkBear_10.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_10.text: It's nothing compared to - well, other things I could be dining on. But significantly better than the rats and bugs Cazador served me.

CRD_DrunkBear_25.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_25.text: You seem happy. No need to drink humanoid blood, then?

CRD_DrunkBear_30.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_30.text: You're comparing plonk to vintage wine. You can make merry with either, but they are not the same.

CRD_DrunkBear_27.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_27.text: But Cazador fed me rats and bugs. And when you're used to drinking from a sewer, even plonk is a marked improvement.

CRD_DrunkBear_33.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_33.text: As long as you're leaving mine alone.

CRD_DrunkBear_14.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_14.text: You think I'd kill you, just like that? Darling, I would never!

CRD_DrunkBear_15.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_15.text: Anyway, the bear will sustain me. And it's a marked improvement over the rats and flies Cazador would feed me.

CRD_DrunkBear_4.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_4.text: It was exactly as appetising as you'd think.

CRD_DrunkBear_18.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_18.text: Does it matter? Blood is blood, isn't it?

CRD_DrunkBear_49.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_49.text: Not at all! Blood is life essence. And some creatures have so much more life than others.

CRD_DrunkBear_0.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_0.text: Cazador gave me just enough to keep me - well, 'alive', for lack of a better word. But never more than that.

CRD_DrunkBear_38.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_38.text: Still, that was the past. I'll never have to grovel for him again.

CRD_DrunkBear_50.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_50.text: True, you can start over. You can be better than what he made you.

CRD_DrunkBear_13.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_13.text: Exactly! I can be better than him. Stronger. More powerful. More -

CRD_DrunkBear_37.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_37.text: - oh, you meant 'be kinder'? Pet bunnies, that sort of thing?

CRD_DrunkBear_59.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_59.text: I've no objection to being nice, of course. Once I have the power to bend others to my will.

CRD_DrunkBear_1.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_1.text: Maybe not, but you'll grovel before the mind flayers if you keep using the tadpole.

CRD_DrunkBear_24.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_24.text: I don't intend to grovel before anyone!

CRD_DrunkBear_63.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_63.text: The mind flayers gave us power, but left us to our own devices. Whatever they had planned for us, they failed.

CRD_DrunkBear_26.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_26.text: And now I'm left with this gift: the strength to take my own freedom. I'm not afraid to use it, and you shouldn't be either.

CRD_DrunkBear_42.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_42.text: Well - look at us. We've never been more powerful.

CRD_DrunkBear_22.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_22.text: And being able to walk in the sunlight opens a lot of doors for me. Maybe some coffins too.

CRD_DrunkBear_16.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_16.text: No, these tadpoles are a gift I intend to use to the fullest. You should do the same.

CRD_DrunkBear_6.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_6.text: Rats? And what did you do to deserve that?

CRD_DrunkBear_32.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_32.text: I existed, that was enough for him. He revelled in having power over me.

CRD_DrunkBear_41.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_41.text: Because those with power can do whatever the hell they want.

CRD_DrunkBear_52.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_52.text: You think power lets you do anything, free from consequences?

CRD_DrunkBear_8.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_8.context: NodeContext: response to "you think power lets you do whatever you want?"

CRD_DrunkBear_43.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_43.text: You can't look at the world and tell me I'm wrong.

CRD_DrunkBear_21.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_21.text: You're free now. That's what matters.

CRD_DrunkBear_51.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_51.text: Is it? What good is freedom if I'm always watching the shadows?

CRD_DrunkBear_39.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_39.text: No, I'll be safe when I'm powerful enough to grind Cazador into the dust. Powerful enough to do whatever the hell I want.

CRD_DrunkBear_61.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_61.text: The strong have a duty to protect the weak.

CRD_DrunkBear_53.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_53.text: They're doing a piss poor job, then.

CRD_DrunkBear_7.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_7.text: The strong had two centuries to pluck me from torture, but no one came. No, it was the mind flayers that rescued me.

CRD_DrunkBear_29.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_29.text: They gave me a gift: the strength to take my own freedom. I'm embracing this power - you should too.
CRD_DrunkBear_29.context: NodeContext: last line: with a little relish

CRD_DrunkBear_2.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_2.text: Power corrupts. You'd do well to remember that.

CRD_DrunkBear_54.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_54.text: Oh I hope so. A little corruption sounds fun.

CRD_DrunkBear_9.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_9.text: I spent centuries as the victim of a corrupt man. It was the mind flayers that plucked me away from that.

CRD_DrunkBear_55.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_55.text: Careful, there are heroes about. I'd hate for them to get the right idea about you.

CRD_DrunkBear_57.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_57.text: Let them. Heroes are half the damn problem. Fools that believe in right and wrong - good and evil.

CRD_DrunkBear_12.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_12.text: Heroes didn't save me from Cazador: mind flayers did.

CRD_DrunkBear_5.speaker: Player
CRD_DrunkBear_5.text: We're not powerless. The tadpoles are quite the asset.

CRD_DrunkBear_46.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_46.text: Indeed they are. Now that I can walk in the sun - well, that opens all manner of doors.

CRD_DrunkBear_56.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_56.text: It could open some coffins too.

CRD_DrunkBear_40.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_40.text: Oh, that. A scratch. I ran afoul of a bear.

CRD_DrunkBear_62.speaker: Astarion
CRD_DrunkBear_62.text: I have drunk. Not alcohol, of course. A bear.

CRD_Mirror_23.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: With his back turned to you. He's holding a mirror, but you can't see it yet.NodeContext: With his back turned to you. He's holding a mirror, but you can't see it yet.

CRD_Mirror_83.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_83.text: How did you know I was here?

CRD_Mirror_54.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_54.text: The only benefit to a mirror when you have my condition.
CRD_Mirror_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds up a mirror to show how he could see youNodeContext: Holds up a mirror to show how he could see you

CRD_Mirror_73.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_73.text: It doesn't quite make up for the lack of a reflection, mind you.
CRD_Mirror_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion watches the player in the mirror as they move through the space where his reflection should be.NodeContext: Astarion watches the player in the mirror as they move through the space where his reflection should be.

CRD_Mirror_3.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_3.text: Just looking. What are you doing?

CRD_Mirror_50.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_50.text: I'm looking too, but not seeing very much.
CRD_Mirror_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds up a mirror to show how he could see youNodeContext: Holds up a mirror to show how he could see you

CRD_Mirror_10.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion watches the player in the mirror as they move through the space where his reflection should be.NodeContext: Astarion watches the player in the mirror as they move through the space where his reflection should be.

CRD_Mirror_12.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_12.text: Do you miss it? Seeing your own face?

CRD_Mirror_84.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_84.text: Preening in the looking glass? Petty vanity? Of course I miss it.
CRD_Mirror_84.context: NodeContext: last line: a little bitter

CRD_Mirror_34.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_34.text: It's an indulgence, I'll grant you, but a weakness? A well-presented face can open a lot of doors.

CRD_Mirror_64.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_64.text: Not that I've seen this face. Not since it grew fangs and its eyes turned red.

CRD_Mirror_52.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_52.text: It's a small price to pay for a vampire's power.

CRD_Mirror_19.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_19.text: To you, maybe. To me it's just another thing Cazador took.

CRD_Mirror_24.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_24.text: I've never even seen this face. Not since it grew fangs and my eyes turned red.

CRD_Mirror_70.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_70.text: I... I don't know. I can't remember.

CRD_Mirror_44.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_44.text: My face is just some dark shape in my past. Another thing I've lost.
CRD_Mirror_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: He hurls the mirror to the ground.NodeContext: He hurls the mirror to the ground.

CRD_Mirror_20.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_20.text: Stare into his eyes, taking in every detail of his face.

CRD_Mirror_80.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_80.text: And what do you see, exactly?

CRD_Mirror_63.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_63.text: I'll be your mirror. What do you want to know?

CRD_Mirror_76.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_76.text: I want to know what the world sees when it looks at me. What you see.

CRD_Mirror_67.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_67.text: Count yourself lucky. I have to see this mug every day.

CRD_Mirror_47.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_47.text: Funny. And what do you see, exactly?

CRD_Mirror_5.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_5.text: Very good. Now just tell me I'm beautiful and we can call it a day.

CRD_Mirror_61.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_61.text: The way your hair curls around your ears.

CRD_Mirror_0.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_0.text: This is meant to be flattery, not poetry. Just tell me I'm beautiful and we can call it a day.

CRD_Mirror_17.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_17.text: Mirrors aren't much use, but being reflected in someone else's eyes?

CRD_Mirror_4.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_4.text: You're pretty good. Not 'Gale' good, but pretty good.

CRD_Mirror_27.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_27.text: How dare you! I thought we had something special.

CRD_Mirror_13.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_13.text: I'd better get some beauty sleep. It seems I need it if I'm to catch up with the competition.

CRD_Mirror_39.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_39.text: Karlach is beautiful. You're fine, though.

CRD_Mirror_49.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_49.text: You don't have Lae'zel's charm, but you're all right.

CRD_Mirror_65.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_65.text: You're fine. Now Shadowheart - there's a beauty!

CRD_Mirror_36.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_36.text: Is that all you want? Shallow praise?

CRD_Mirror_57.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_57.text: Hardly. There's also gold, sex, revenge - quite the list, really.

CRD_Mirror_38.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_38.text: But failing any of those, I will always settle for shallow praise.

CRD_Mirror_6.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_6.text: Your mole definitely grabs my attention.

CRD_Mirror_56.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Worried. Turns and hurrys awayNodeContext: Worried. Turns and hurrys away

CRD_Mirror_11.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_11.text: An elven vampire spawn, approximately 5'11", medium build...

CRD_Mirror_72.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_72.text: Gods above. Would it kill you to dispense a compliment?

CRD_Mirror_15.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_15.text: When you smile, your face wrinkles. It is comforting.

CRD_Mirror_45.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_45.text: Excuse me? I'm an eternally young vampire, not your doting grandmother.

CRD_Mirror_37.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_37.text: You can do better. What else?

CRD_Mirror_51.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_51.text: Despite being neither brave nor intelligent, you are one of the finest killers I've ever seen.

CRD_Mirror_75.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_75.context: NodeContext: He just 'complimented' you by calling you stupid and a coward, but a good killer.

CRD_Mirror_60.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_60.text: Let's leave it there, shall we? It's been a long day and I've had all the compliments I can take.

CRD_Mirror_32.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_32.text: I see someone wasting my time.

CRD_Mirror_1.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_1.text: Oh pardon, I didn't want to inconvenience you with my age-old curse.

CRD_Mirror_77.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_77.text: For you maybe, but I like what I see.

CRD_Mirror_41.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_41.text: It's for the best, you're not exactly ageing gracefully.

CRD_Mirror_30.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_30.text: Sure, but was your mole always so... prominent?

CRD_Mirror_7.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_7.text: So is the tadpole causing all that sagging skin, or...

CRD_Mirror_42.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_42.text: What are you talking about? My skin isn't... is it?
CRD_Mirror_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Touching his faceNodeContext: Starts touching his face, worried

CRD_Mirror_48.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_48.context: NodeContext: Blatantly fishing for a compliment

CRD_Mirror_74.speaker: Player
CRD_Mirror_74.text: You have nothing to worry about - it's a very good face.

CRD_Mirror_21.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_21.text: Is it? What do you see when you look at me?

CRD_Mirror_26.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Mirror_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stares down at the mirror in his hands, watching you goNodeContext: He stares down at the mirror in his hands, watching you go

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_9.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_9.text: *You rarely rest well, but tonight something feels different. Whether it's the parasite within your brain or the darkness without, you're deeply uneasy.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_3.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_3.text: *Again and again, your thoughts return to memories of pain. Of suffering. Of Cazador.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_23.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_23.text: *You remember his small cruelties. You remember his sadistic whims. And you remember the long night he spent carving 'poetry' into your back.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_21.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_21.text: *Deep in your trance it all feels vividly real again - the jagged cuts of the 'needle' he used on you, the shapes he traced into your flesh. You can almost tell what he's writing.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_18.speaker: Astarion
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_18.text: Focus on the pain in your back - try to understand what he's carving.

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_4.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_4.text: *Your body is racked by agony, but you push through it, carefully tracking the movement and position of every tear and slice.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_13.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_13.text: *Despite the horror your body feels, you slowly start to build up a picture of what your old master carved, recognising not words, but runes. Infernal runes.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_20.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_20.text: *Unable to decipher the arcane symbols, you have to admit defeat and give yourself over to the pain.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_17.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_17.text: *You spend the rest of the night reliving your torment, but if nothing else, you know your scars are not what they seemed to be.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_10.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_10.text: *You try to focus, but the pain is too much. As one cut flows into the next you lose all track of their shapes, leaving you with nothing but a haze of pain.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_2.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_2.text: *You spend the rest of the night reliving your torment, none the wiser about what your old master did to you.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_12.speaker: Astarion
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_12.text: Push the pain away, try to banish the memory.

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_7.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_7.text: *You gather yourself, building one mental wall after another against the waves of pain that wash over you.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_0.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_0.text: *At first you can't fight the torrent of memories, but soon you find a foothold. You can push them back - push them down until you feel nothing.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_22.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_22.text: *Freed from the ghost of your past, you can finally rest and dream of brilliant futures.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_14.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_14.text: *You gather yourself, trying to build mental walls against the pain, but they're assaulted by one tortured memory after another.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_1.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_1.text: *Eventually your meagre defences are washed away and you succumb to a long, tormented night.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_19.speaker: Astarion
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_19.text: Do not resist. Let your mind wander as it will.

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_11.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_11.text: *You spend the night drifting from one torture to another, but in time the memories become less visceral.*

SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_8.speaker: Narrator
SCO_CazadorNightmare_SecondDream_8.text: *Eventually you drift to a quiet place and the terrors subside. You do not rest well, but you do finally rest.*

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_47.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_47.text: Do you know what happens when a devil is struck down on this charming plane of existence?

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_59.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_59.text: It returns to the hells - to the very point where it last stood before venturing to whichever devilforsaken plane it died on.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_53.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_53.text: In the case of our friend Yurgir, the orthon you so handily dispatched in the temple of Shar, he manifested in my House of Hope.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_24.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_24.text: He returned to me chastened but intact, his wounds healed, his body restored.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_8.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_8.text: He thought I would dismember him but he has his uses so instead I am reeducating him.
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_8.context: NodeContext: with a sadistic grin, relishing what you did to this creature that is no longer 'intact'

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_9.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_9.text: We delivered the devil. Now I want what I'm owed - we had a deal.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_33.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_33.text: Indeed we did. I discovered all there is to know about those scars of yours - it's a rather grim tale, even for my tastes.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_0.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_0.text: We had a deal - the orthon for information.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_48.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_48.text: Please, give me more boring details about your plans.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_63.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_63.text: Come now, we're about to unveil your destiny - you should be quivering in anticipation.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_11.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_11.text: As you wish. Brace yourself, Astarion - we're about to unveil your destiny.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_62.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_62.text: Are you sure you want to know, Astarion? Maybe it's best left in the past.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_40.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_40.text: Even if I wanted to walk away from all of this, I can't. Cazador won't let me.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_69.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_69.text: And why would he want to walk away? This is his destiny.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_35.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_35.text: I'd appreciate a little less enthusiasm when it comes to Cazador and his horrors.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_16.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_16.text: Oh come, Astarion. We're about to unveil your destiny - you should be quivering in anticipation.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_20.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_20.text: As you know already, your precious skin is home to one part of a contract between the archdevil Mephistopheles, and your former master, Cazador Szarr.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_44.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_44.text: In full, the contract states that Cazador will be granted knowledge of an infernal ritual so vile it has never been performed.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_15.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_15.text: It promises to be a marvellous ceremony. Very elaborate, incredibly ancient, and entirely diabolical.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_43.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_43.text: If he completes the rite, he will become a new kind of being - the Vampire Ascendant.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_56.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_56.text: All the strengths of his vampiric form will be amplified, and alongside them he will enjoy the luxuries of the living.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_60.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_60.text: The arousals and appetites of man will return to him, and unlike Astarion, he will have no need of a parasite to protect him from the sun.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_1.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_1.text: The arousals and appetites of man will return to him, and unlike you, he will have no need of a parasite to protect him from the sun.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_12.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_12.text: But the ritual has its price, as all worthwhile things do. Lord Cazador will need to sacrifice a number of souls, including all of his vampiric spawn, if he is to ascend.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_76.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_76.text: Imagine how he felt, then, when one of those precious spawn simply disappeared into thin air.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_57.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_57.text: The only missing ingredient is Astarion.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_5.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_5.text: You are the final piece he requires to complete the ritual - your scars bind you to it. Your soul will set off a very wave of death, bringing Cazador his twisted life.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_67.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_67.text: And that, my tragic and toothsome friend, is that. Now if you'll excuse me, I have business elsewhere.
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael disappears with a click of his fingers and a puff of smokeNodeContext: [Tarik] snaps fingers at the end of the line.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_21.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_21.text: Cazador is a piece of shit. We're going to stop him.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_42.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_42.text: 'Hmm'? That's all you have to say?

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_28.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_28.text: I was... contemplating. It's a lot to take in.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_58.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_58.text: What do you think I should do?

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_3.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_3.text: We can't let Cazador complete that ritual. He could unleash terrible horrors.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_45.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_45.text: The end of my life among them. Just when I was starting to enjoy it.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_39.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_39.text: I think you should run. If Cazador can't find you, he can't complete his ritual.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_26.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_26.text: How long do you think I can run? He has eternity to find me.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_18.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_18.text: He'll never leave me alone. I didn't think he would when I was just one more wretched toy for him to play with.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_46.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_46.text: But if I'm the key to this power he craves, he'll hunt me to the ends of Faerûn.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_6.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_6.text: You'll never be free while Cazador lives.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_64.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_64.text: I hate how right you are.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_61.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_61.text: I knew he wouldn't leave me alone even when I was just another wretched toy for him to play with.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_13.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_13.text: There's a way to become a living vampire... That must mean a lot to you.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_25.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_25.text: I could get rid of the worm in my head and still walk in the sun. I'd finally be free of the hunger.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_27.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_27.text: And if I'm the key to this deal of Cazador's, perhaps I can turn this to my advantage...

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_2.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_2.text: I need to take the fight to him.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_32.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_32.text: And I need you to help me.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_10.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_10.text: After we dealt with our tadpole problem, yes, I'll help you then.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_72.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_72.text: Once we deal with the tadpole, I'll be back to my nocturnal self. When you're being hunted by vampires, the dark is the worst place to hide.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_66.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_66.text: I need to deal with Cazador while I still have any kind of advantage over him.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_7.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_7.text: Of course I'll help. We'll hunt him down and kill him.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_50.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_50.text: If he comes for you, I'll defend you. But we're not risking an attack on his lair.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_71.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_71.text: If you won't risk taking him on for my sake, think of the innocent souls he'll sacrifice in this ritual.
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_71.context: NodeContext: Angry, but keeping it well in control. He didn't get the answer he wanted from the player.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_14.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_14.text: The Absolute is a greater threat - we need to focus.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_74.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_74.text: You're right - I'll help you destroy him.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_22.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_22.text: We're done talking about this, Astarion. My decision is made.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_65.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_65.context: NodeContext: angry, but controlling his fury

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_41.speaker: Player
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_41.text: You don't need to go back to Cazador - you're with me now.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_38.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_38.text: Do you think it's so simple?

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_52.speaker: Astarion
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_52.text: It's a lot to take in.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_37.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_37.text: Carved into that ivory skin of yours is one part of an infernal contract between the archdevil Mephistopheles and your former master, Cazador Szarr.

RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_54.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelsRevelation_CFM_54.text: Do you know what happens when a devil is struck down on this charming plane of existence?

CRD_TastingParty_27.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_27.text: You know, I was just thinking about you. Remembering our little encounter in the night.

CRD_TastingParty_89.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_89.text: When you tried to bite me?

CRD_TastingParty_98.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_98.text: The very same. It obviously put me off your neck, but now I can't help but wonder how the others taste.

CRD_TastingParty_15.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_15.text: You can rest easy, I don't intend a repeat performance. Although I do wonder how the others might taste.

CRD_TastingParty_87.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_87.text: Not that anyone's volunteered, it's just an idle fancy.

CRD_TastingParty_73.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_73.text: I wouldn't expect any volunteers either.

CRD_TastingParty_71.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_71.text: Do you have your eye on anyone in particular?

CRD_TastingParty_79.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_79.text: No, that's the thing. I can't quite figure them out.

CRD_TastingParty_56.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_56.text: A dangerous 'fancy'. They're all off the menu.

CRD_TastingParty_74.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_74.text: A pity, they can be annoying sometimes.

CRD_TastingParty_38.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_38.text: We still need them. That doesn't stop me from wondering, of course.

CRD_TastingParty_68.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_68.text: You're lucky I didn't kill you.

CRD_TastingParty_57.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_57.text: And I am very grateful. It did get me thinking about the others, though. How they might taste.

CRD_TastingParty_60.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_60.text: There you are, I was just thinking about you. And that delicious moment we shared the other night.

CRD_TastingParty_77.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_77.text: The moment when you bit me?

CRD_TastingParty_43.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_43.text: The very same. I've had this condition for two centuries, but truth be told? You were my first.

CRD_TastingParty_63.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_63.text: Savour the memory. It won't happen again.

CRD_TastingParty_84.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_84.text: Pity, you're tastier than you know. And you were my first.

CRD_TastingParty_67.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_67.text: I had to fight you off me!

CRD_TastingParty_42.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_42.text: Yes, I'm still rather tender, now that you mention it.
CRD_TastingParty_42.context: NodeContext: recalls player kneeing him in the balls

CRD_TastingParty_70.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_70.text: I admit, I may have been a little eager. But can you blame me? You were my first.

CRD_TastingParty_10.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_10.text: And I am deeply sorry. I was overeager - but can you blame me? You were my first.

CRD_TastingParty_3.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_3.text: In all these years, I've only ever fed on beasts. Drinking the blood of thinking creatures is a different thing entirely.

CRD_TastingParty_95.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_95.text: You were delectable. And now I just can't help but wonder how the others taste.

CRD_TastingParty_97.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_97.text: They might not be as open to the idea as I was.

CRD_TastingParty_19.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_19.text: Alas. It doesn't hurt to ponder the question, though.

CRD_TastingParty_6.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_6.text: Hurt them and I'll kill you, no hesitation.

CRD_TastingParty_61.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_61.text: You're a sweetheart, but you don't need to worry - I'm just thinking out loud.

CRD_TastingParty_62.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_62.text: You're looking at other necks? I'm hurt.

CRD_TastingParty_37.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_37.text: Don't worry, there's enough of me to go around. I'm a man of tremendous appetites.

CRD_TastingParty_41.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_41.text: I don't think they'd volunteer, of course, but it doesn't make me any less curious.

CRD_TastingParty_91.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_91.text: I'm all too familiar with Gale's blood, unfortunately. I can't recommend it.

CRD_TastingParty_17.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_17.text: Take Gale, for example. He strikes me as someone whose blood is rich, refined like a well-aged brandy.

CRD_TastingParty_82.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_82.text: But Karlach? A tiefling seasoned by hellsfire? What could she possibly taste like?

CRD_TastingParty_48.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_48.text: Something potent, I'm sure. A smoky Waterdeep whiskey?

CRD_TastingParty_55.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_55.text: Take Wyll, for example. A man of the people, very palatable, like a sweet cider.

CRD_TastingParty_54.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_54.text: Take Shadowheart, for example. She strikes me as having a heavy, enigmatic flavour - vintage port on two legs.

CRD_TastingParty_9.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_9.text: Take Karlach, for example, her blood aged in the Hells. She's potent, like a fiery whiskey.

CRD_TastingParty_18.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_18.text: But the gith? What in the hells would she taste like?

CRD_TastingParty_39.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_39.text: Something exotic, surely? An Amnan liqueur?

CRD_TastingParty_94.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_94.text: I'd prefer a beer, if it's all the same to you.

CRD_TastingParty_12.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_12.text: Yes, heavens forbid we'd have an interesting conversation.

CRD_TastingParty_36.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_36.text: Still, I am intrigued by the possibilities...

CRD_TastingParty_66.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_66.text: Keep your eyes to yourself. You'll make people nervous.

CRD_TastingParty_7.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_7.text: So - in the spirit of theoretical questions - if you had to take a bite from one of them, who would it be?

CRD_TastingParty_32.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_32.text: I much prefer eating flesh to blood.

CRD_TastingParty_78.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_78.text: I do appreciate your enthusiasm, but let's try to restrain ourselves a little.

CRD_TastingParty_4.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_4.text: Are you really asking which of our companions I'd eat?

CRD_TastingParty_52.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_52.context: NodeContext: response to "are you asking which of my friends I'd want to eat?!"

CRD_TastingParty_33.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_33.text: I just mean a sip of their blood. No mastication required.

CRD_TastingParty_58.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_58.text: What? I was only making conversation!

CRD_TastingParty_20.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_20.text: Honestly, you have no sense of fun.

CRD_TastingParty_1.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_1.text: Ah, a refined palate! I can't disagree.

CRD_TastingParty_14.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_14.text: Although the more I think on it, the hungrier I get. I'd better go find something I can actually get my teeth into.

CRD_TastingParty_96.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_96.text: There's nothing that tasty lurking out in the woods, but I'll make do. Sweet dreams.

CRD_TastingParty_93.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_93.text: Nothing out there will taste as good as the alternatives, but I'll make do. Sweet dreams.

CRD_TastingParty_69.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_69.text: Anything that keeps you away from our necks.

CRD_TastingParty_0.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_0.text: I could be tempted to try Lae'zel.

CRD_TastingParty_26.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_26.text: Mmm, a meal that would put up a fight. An adventurous choice.

CRD_TastingParty_65.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_65.text: A fine choice. She is enticing.

CRD_TastingParty_86.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_86.text: Interesting. I always thought he'd taste a little too sweet.

CRD_TastingParty_30.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_30.text: Oh, I'm flattered. Who knew you had such taste?

CRD_TastingParty_45.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_45.text: Unfortunately, all this talk is getting me hungry. I'd better find something I can actually sink my teeth into.

CRD_TastingParty_23.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_23.text: Could I convince you to kill someone less useful?

CRD_TastingParty_47.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_47.text: No one's getting killed, I swear. We're just two friends talking.

CRD_TastingParty_85.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_85.text: But Shadowheart? I have no idea. How do you think our little enigma would taste?

CRD_TastingParty_29.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_29.text: Something that could lay you out. Calishite Absinthe, maybe?

CRD_TastingParty_76.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_76.text: Ohh, that sounds very appealing. I'm almost convinced.

CRD_TastingParty_34.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_34.text: And Wyll? Well, I'm not quite sure. How do you think he'd taste?

CRD_TastingParty_51.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_51.text: He has a good heart. I'm sure he tastes sweet as any cider.

CRD_TastingParty_50.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_50.text: We are not having this conversation. Good night.

CRD_TastingParty_11.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_11.text: Good. I was getting tired of them anyway.

CRD_TastingParty_75.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_75.text: I'm not going to bite any of them. They don't seem as accommodating as you were.

CRD_TastingParty_92.speaker: Player
CRD_TastingParty_92.text: You're lucky I didn't drive that stake into your heart.

CRD_TastingParty_21.speaker: Astarion
CRD_TastingParty_21.text: I appreciate your restraint. It would have spoiled the mood - you were my first, after all.

CRD_ScarReading_140.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_140.text: A line with a fork and one - two - three dots?
CRD_ScarReading_140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing away from you, trying to trace runes on his back with his fingers.InternalNodeContext: Astarion found out it was Infernal during the romance sceneNodeContext: Facing away from you, trying to trace runes on his back with his fingers.

CRD_ScarReading_5.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_5.text: Bloody Infernal - how is anyone meant to read this garbage?
CRD_ScarReading_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing away from you.NodeContext: Facing away from you.

CRD_ScarReading_221.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_221.text: It's easy for some of us.

CRD_ScarReading_138.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_138.text: Offering to help. I can tell you what it says, if you want.

CRD_ScarReading_217.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_217.text: I am perfectly capable, thank you. This isn't your concern.

CRD_ScarReading_173.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_173.text: Well find something else to gawp at. I'm busy and I don't need your help.

CRD_ScarReading_211.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_211.text: The little I read looked pretty dangerous, but if you don't want to know...

CRD_ScarReading_12.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_12.text: What? I - well, maybe you could have a look.
CRD_ScarReading_12.context: NodeContext: Just been told that what's on his back might be dangerous.

CRD_ScarReading_170.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_170.text: *The jagged script is definitely Infernal, the language of the Hells, but you can't make out its meaning.*

CRD_ScarReading_49.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_49.text: *The jagged script is definitely Infernal, a language you know all too well.*

CRD_ScarReading_157.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_157.text: *The lines describe oaths and 'the fires below', but the language is fragmented and strange. This is just a piece of a larger text.*

CRD_ScarReading_172.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_172.text: *You run your eyes over the runes hacked into his flesh and recognise an all-too-familiar language: Infernal. It's the language of the Hells.*

CRD_ScarReading_127.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_127.text: *You can't read the text carved into his flesh, but you recognise the script - any warlock would. It's Infernal, the language of the Hells.*

CRD_ScarReading_234.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_234.text: Something about 'the fires below'? It's just fragments of Infernal legalese.

CRD_ScarReading_202.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_202.text: It's not a poem. It might be part of a devil's pact...

CRD_ScarReading_233.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_233.text: An infernal pact? But not even the whole text?

CRD_ScarReading_207.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_207.text: What was that bastard up to?
CRD_ScarReading_207.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face the playerNodeContext: Turns to face the player

CRD_ScarReading_51.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_51.text: If he did make a devil's pact, he's more dangerous than we thought.

CRD_ScarReading_13.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_13.text: More dangerous than you thought, perhaps. I've never had any doubt.

CRD_ScarReading_128.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_128.text: But if Cazador drew up a contract with someone in the Hells, then we need details from Raphael. There must be immense power on the line.

CRD_ScarReading_243.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_243.text: But if this is part of a contract, it must be powerful. Or valuable. Or both.

CRD_ScarReading_41.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_41.text: Does it matter? You're free of him now.

CRD_ScarReading_109.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_109.text: It matters! It's carved into my back - whatever this is, it's part of me.

CRD_ScarReading_73.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_73.text: No wonder he wants me back. What have I run off with...

CRD_ScarReading_177.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_177.text: What have I run off with...

CRD_ScarReading_40.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_40.text: We should tell the others. They might be able to help.

CRD_ScarReading_117.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_117.text: It's written in Infernal, I can't read it.

CRD_ScarReading_26.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_26.text: Infernal? Are you sure? Can you show me?

CRD_ScarReading_154.context: CinematicNodeContext: You grab a stick and draw a copy of the 'poem' into the dirt.

CRD_ScarReading_14.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to look at the symbols you've drawn on the groundNodeContext: Turning to look at the symbols you've drawn on the ground

CRD_ScarReading_58.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_58.text: What did he do to me?

CRD_ScarReading_227.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_227.text: I have absolutely no idea. But it's no poem.

CRD_ScarReading_67.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_67.text: Should we ask the others? They might know something.

CRD_ScarReading_71.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_71.text: No! No, let's keep this between ourselves. At least until we know what it means.

CRD_ScarReading_183.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_183.text: Two centuries carrying this, and I can finally see it.

CRD_ScarReading_206.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_206.text: You really have no idea what this is?

CRD_ScarReading_107.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_107.text: It doesn't look like a poem. It doesn't look like anything I recognise.

CRD_ScarReading_85.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_85.text: If anyone can tell us, Raphael can.

CRD_ScarReading_34.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_34.text: I'm sure he can. A shame it took a deal with a devil to unravel this.

CRD_ScarReading_115.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_115.text: Still, I've made my bed with Raphael. We'll know soon enough.

CRD_ScarReading_18.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_18.text: Whatever you find, you don't have to deal with it alone.

CRD_ScarReading_259.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_259.text: Thank you. It never really occurred to me to ask for help, and - well...

CRD_ScarReading_200.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_200.text: I suppose 'thank you' covered it, really. But I do mean it. I'm grateful - for all of this.

CRD_ScarReading_60.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_60.text: When Cazador first carved this on me, I didn't fight back. I couldn't. I just knelt there as it happened to me.

CRD_ScarReading_253.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_253.text: But now that I'm free of him, now that I have a choice, I will do whatever it takes to fight. I'll pay any price to undo what he did to me.

CRD_ScarReading_59.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_59.text: Thank you, by the way. This may not be your fight exactly, but you're willing to help. That means a lot.

CRD_ScarReading_3.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_3.text: Did you ever see Cazador write in Infernal before?

CRD_ScarReading_210.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_210.text: No. I could have missed it, of course, but I doubt it.

CRD_ScarReading_141.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_141.text: Cazador was only figuratively hellish - there were never any devils hanging about the crypt.

CRD_ScarReading_185.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_185.text: Whatever he's left carved in my flesh, it's a mystery to me.

CRD_ScarReading_213.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_213.text: Thank you, by the way. This is... well, it's something.
CRD_ScarReading_213.context: NodeContext: With a sigh. This has been taxing

CRD_ScarReading_91.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_91.text: We'll figure it out. I promise.

CRD_ScarReading_240.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_240.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is being hopelessly nieve

CRD_ScarReading_153.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_153.text: Given the subject matter, I probably won't.

CRD_ScarReading_24.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_24.text: Just make sure it doesn't get us killed, all right?

CRD_ScarReading_212.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_212.text: Someone out there will be able to read it, I'm sure.

CRD_ScarReading_179.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_179.text: I'm sure, but what will it say?

CRD_ScarReading_21.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_21.text: If this is part of a contract, where's the rest?

CRD_ScarReading_104.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_104.text: I wasn't his only spawn. And he tortured us all - I imagine each of us are carrying a piece of this infernal contract.

CRD_ScarReading_180.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_180.text: But what could a devil have offered Cazador? He had wealth, power, control - what more could you want?

CRD_ScarReading_208.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_208.text: Perplexed. This was a surprise, and Cazador's surprises are never good.

CRD_ScarReading_161.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_161.text: Then again, even he couldn't know I'd be kidnapped. Whatever he planned, it's gone wrong. Which gives us an advantage.

CRD_ScarReading_113.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_113.text: If it's a poem at all...

CRD_ScarReading_250.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_250.text: What does it matter? You're free of him now.

CRD_ScarReading_260.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_260.text: *The pattern swirls before you, runes hacked crudely into his flesh. You can't read it, but you recognise the letters: Infernal, the language of the Hells.*

CRD_ScarReading_37.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_37.text: *The runes are carved in deep, brutal strokes, but the jagged letters mean nothing to you. Whatever language this is, you don't recognise it.*

CRD_ScarReading_246.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_246.text: I'm not sure. Hold still, I'll draw it for you.

CRD_ScarReading_223.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_223.text: Nothing. It's just a bunch of strange symbols.

CRD_ScarReading_216.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_216.text: It's not a poem? That can't be good.

CRD_ScarReading_33.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_33.text: What are these symbols? There must be something you can tell me about them?

CRD_ScarReading_29.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_29.text: Examine the runes, trying to identify the script.

CRD_ScarReading_82.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_82.text: *You search for anything you can identify and recognise a couple of symbols associated with the Hells. You suspect it's written in Infernal.*

CRD_ScarReading_186.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_186.text: Why would he write a poem in Infernal? Why would he write anything in Infernal?
CRD_ScarReading_186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back to face the playerNodeContext: Turns back to face the player

CRD_ScarReading_171.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_171.text: What is it, if not a poem?

CRD_ScarReading_121.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_121.text: It's a surprise. And Cazador's surprises are never good.

CRD_ScarReading_84.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_84.text: *You search for anything you recognise - a letter, a rune, something - but there's nothing. You can't even tell what script it's written in.*

CRD_ScarReading_1.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_1.text: They're just symbols, arranged in a circle.

CRD_ScarReading_87.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_87.text: Useless. Why do I even bother with you?
CRD_ScarReading_87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back to face the playerNodeContext: Turns back to face the player

CRD_ScarReading_118.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_118.text: At least I still have the devil. He'll deliver, even if it's at a price.

CRD_ScarReading_168.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_168.text: I thought you could help me, but no - I'll have to make my own way. As usual.

CRD_ScarReading_75.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_75.text: 'There once was a cleric of Gond, who was cursed with a very small wand...'

CRD_ScarReading_244.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_244.context: NodeContext: quickly running out of patience

CRD_ScarReading_146.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_146.text: You sweetheart. But while you're here, maybe there's something else you could look at?

CRD_ScarReading_11.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_11.text: Want me to take a look?

CRD_ScarReading_197.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_197.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised, snapping his words.

CRD_ScarReading_111.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_111.text: Wait - I'm sorry. You caught me by surprise, that's all.

CRD_ScarReading_203.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_203.text: I've been tracing the scars on my back with my fingers, trying to read them by touch, but I can't. They may as well be written in Rashemi.

CRD_ScarReading_64.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_64.text: Good. This is personal and we're travelling companions, not friends.

CRD_ScarReading_195.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_195.text: I - well, if you must know, I've been trying to make out the scars on my back.

CRD_ScarReading_144.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_144.text: I can't see them, so I've been trying to feel my way about, but they may as well be written in Rashemi.

CRD_ScarReading_231.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_231.text: I was minding my own business. If only everyone was so considerate.

CRD_ScarReading_89.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_89.text: Listen, we travel together, but we're not friends. I'm not about to share anything with someone I can't trust.

CRD_ScarReading_77.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_77.text: I was hoping to hear a little poetry. What's it say?

CRD_ScarReading_222.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_222.text: ...I have no idea. I've been trying to trace the words, but they may as well be written in Rashemi.

CRD_ScarReading_147.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_147.text: I - this isn't your problem, you know.

CRD_ScarReading_129.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_129.text: I know. Now shut up and turn around.

CRD_ScarReading_95.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

CRD_ScarReading_192.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_192.text: All right, if you don't want answers...

CRD_ScarReading_255.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_255.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: 'here' said with a sign/resignation. Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

CRD_ScarReading_8.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_8.text: You're right, it's not. Good luck.

CRD_ScarReading_242.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_242.context: NodeContext: The player's walking away when you secretly wanted their help

CRD_ScarReading_245.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_245.text: Want me to get a mirror?

CRD_ScarReading_108.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_108.context: NodeContext: Player just asked if you want a mirror. You're not impressed. (Maybe rubbing your temples for some 'I can't believe you just said that' body language)

CRD_ScarReading_106.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_106.text: I can't read it with a mirror and it seems I can't read it with my hands either.

CRD_ScarReading_50.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_50.text: Smile and say nothing, waiting for him to speak.

CRD_ScarReading_155.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_155.text: So... I was wondering if maybe - perhaps - you might be able to...

CRD_ScarReading_80.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_80.text: Can you read what's on my damned back? Please.

CRD_ScarReading_52.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his backNodeContext: Turns away from the player so they can look at his back

CRD_ScarReading_196.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_196.text: It's a sonnet about minding your own damn business.

CRD_ScarReading_165.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_165.text: Those runes look occult. I can probably read them, if you like?

CRD_ScarReading_110.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_110.text: I - I suppose it couldn't hurt.

CRD_ScarReading_70.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_70.text: You can let me look or spend all night twisting yourself into knots. Your call.

CRD_ScarReading_92.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_92.text: It's my back. My skin. My business.

CRD_ScarReading_228.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_228.text: Look past the bluster and try to discern his true feelings.

CRD_ScarReading_96.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_96.text: *He might be sneering, but you can see pain in his eyes. He needs help, but doesn't know how to ask.*

CRD_ScarReading_10.speaker: Narrator
CRD_ScarReading_10.text: *You examine his face, but all you can see are sneering fangs. His defences are up and you're not getting past them.*

CRD_ScarReading_61.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_61.text: I don't need help. And certainly not from you.

CRD_ScarReading_169.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_169.text: Now, if you don't mind - piss off.

CRD_ScarReading_131.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_131.text: Just looking. What's that on your back?

CRD_ScarReading_48.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_48.text: Oh, it's you. Well, I'm glad you like them.
CRD_ScarReading_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.

CRD_ScarReading_249.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_249.text: A gift from Cazador, written in flesh. I think it says 'mind your own damn business'.

CRD_ScarReading_120.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_120.text: A gift from Cazador, written in flesh. Apparently it's a poem, but I've never read it.

CRD_ScarReading_88.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_88.text: I thought you didn't care what Cazador wrote on your back.

CRD_ScarReading_103.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_103.text: Ah! There you are. I admit, I got curious.
CRD_ScarReading_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.

CRD_ScarReading_252.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_252.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised.NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. He's not happy to see you.

CRD_ScarReading_257.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_257.text: I admit, I was curious, but it's hardly your concern. I'm happy to do this alone.

CRD_ScarReading_235.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_235.text: I - F - or is it an E? Is it even a letter?
CRD_ScarReading_235.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing away from you, trying to trace runes on his back with his fingers.InternalNodeContext: Astarion didn't find out it was Infernal during the romance sceneNodeContext: Facing away from you, trying to trace runes on his back with his fingers.

CRD_ScarReading_122.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Facing away from you.NodeContext: Emphasis on 'is'. Facing away from you.

CRD_ScarReading_198.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_198.text: Ah! What the hells are you - wait, did you say Infernal?
CRD_ScarReading_198.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. NodeContext: He turns to you, surprised. Full line - "What are you doing here?"

CRD_ScarReading_16.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_16.text: Yes, I can read it if you turn around.

CRD_ScarReading_119.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_119.text: But you can read it? You can tell me what it says?

CRD_ScarReading_152.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_152.text: Never mind. It's not your concern.

CRD_ScarReading_45.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_45.text: Don't ask me, it's your body...

CRD_ScarReading_9.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_9.text: Yes, but you can read it? You can tell me what it says?

CRD_ScarReading_23.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_23.context: NodeContext: A little reluctant, he feels uncomfortably vulnerable

CRD_ScarReading_101.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_101.text: Oh no, I'm not getting involved.

CRD_ScarReading_254.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_254.text: Of course not. Why would I expect anything else?

CRD_ScarReading_226.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_226.text: Still, you're not the only person in the world that can read Infernal. I'll do this on my own. As I always do.

CRD_ScarReading_56.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_56.text: Very true. This is nothing to concern yourself with.

CRD_ScarReading_4.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_4.text: It's easy for some of us.

CRD_ScarReading_93.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_93.text: Did you not get enough of an eyeful back with Raphael?
CRD_ScarReading_93.context: NodeContext: Not angry, but a little miffed. Referring to when Raphael magicked away your shirt before.

CRD_ScarReading_176.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_176.text: Although I've been able to make out exactly none of this on my own...

CRD_ScarReading_248.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_248.text: Want me to take a look?

CRD_ScarReading_44.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_44.text: Trying to decode the scars before Raphael does?

CRD_ScarReading_224.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_224.text: I thought maybe if I could read them myself, we wouldn't have to play whatever game that devil's concocting, but it's no use.

CRD_ScarReading_69.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_69.text: I do hate that he just... revealed everything to you, by the way. I would have liked to tell you in my own time.

CRD_ScarReading_194.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_194.text: But now that I know, why not let me take a look? I can read Infernal, after all.

CRD_ScarReading_188.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_188.text: But now that I know, let me help you read it.

CRD_ScarReading_209.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_209.text: How much of it have you read?

CRD_ScarReading_62.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_62.text: Oh, and when were you going to tell me?

CRD_ScarReading_98.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_98.text: I'm not one to drop my guard and trust the first person who flounces up to me after we crash out of the sky.

CRD_ScarReading_43.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_43.text: Well I know now, so why not show me? I can read Infernal, after all.

CRD_ScarReading_187.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_187.text: Well I know now, so let me help you read it.

CRD_ScarReading_256.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_256.text: I'll know soon enough. The devil will deliver, once the price is right.

CRD_ScarReading_184.speaker: Player
CRD_ScarReading_184.text: How do you know it's Infernal?

CRD_ScarReading_72.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_72.text: I've been wearing these scars for so many years, I started to feel around back there. Try to figure out what poem Cazador cut into me.

CRD_ScarReading_225.speaker: Astarion
CRD_ScarReading_225.text: I couldn't make out much the first time I tried, but I recognised that jagged Hells-script. Hence, approaching Raphael.
